questions.question: Don’t forget, ………………………..?
questions.description: After a negative imperative we use will you in question tags.

questions.question: They have got six children ……………………….. are studying music.
I will never forget the day ………………………….. we met.
questions.description: After nouns referring to time we can use that instead of when.

questions.question: The reason ……………………………… I dislike you is that you are so bad-tempered.
questions.description: Either why or that can be used after that.

questions.question: Please remind me …………………………. the oil.
questions.description: Remind is followed by object + infinitive.

questions.question: She …………………………. me that we hadn’t bought anything to eat.
questions.description: To remind somebody is to make them remember.

questions.question: You remind me ……………………………… I had met at school.
questions.description: Of is required in this structure.

questions.question: He is a stern man who always ………………………………. me of my headmaster.
She is a kind woman who always makes me ……………………………. my grandmother.
He suggested …………………………… the main car park.
questions.description: We cannot use an infinitive after suggest.

questions.question: He said ……………………………….. park there.
questions.description: We use a that-clause after said.

questions.question: He told ……………………………
questions.description: Tell can be followed by object + infinitive or object + that clause.
